name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Gerald R. WENTZ, Appellant

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Gerald R. WENTZ, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The Appeal, 421 A.2d 796, is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Wilbert H. Beachy, III, Public Defender, Somerset, for appellant.
Alan Ellis, Philadelphia, for amicus curiae, Amicus Curiae Committee, Nat. Ass’n of Criminal Defense Lawyers, Inc. (NACDL).
Leonard N. Sosnov, Philadelphia, amicus curiae.
James B. Yelovich, Dist. Atty., Somerset, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
435 A.2d 176
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Gerald R. WENTZ, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 15, 1981.
Decided Oct. 8, 1981.
Wilbert H. Beachy, III, Public Defender, Somerset, for appellant.
Alan Ellis, Philadelphia, for amicus curiae, Amicus Curiae Committee, Nat. Ass’n of Criminal Defense Lawyers, Inc. (NACDL).
Leonard N. Sosnov, Philadelphia, amicus curiae.
James B. Yelovich, Dist. Atty., Somerset, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C.J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
